intro: Kippistia cognata, commonly known as the lesser kippistia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and pinnately compound leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers. Kippistia cognata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests.
